DOC.brief_summary: The hypothesis is that varenicline will be effective (compared with placebo) for smoking cessation when subjects are allowed to set their own quit date within the first 5 weeks of treatment.
DOC.brief_title: Randomized Study Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of Varenicline Tartrate to Placebo in Smoking Cessation When Subjects Are Allowed to Set Their Own Quit Date
DOC.criteria: Men and women 18 to 75 yrs old Motivated to stop smoking Smoke at least 10 cigarettes/day Active psychiatric disease Severe or unstable cardiovascular or pulmonary disease Current or recent treatment to stop smoking Previous use of varenicline
